verses.verse: Thou shalt not see<WH7200> thy brother<WH251>'s ox<WH7794> or his sheep<WH7716> go astray<WH5080>, and hide<WH5956> thyself from them<WH7725>: thou shalt surely bring them again<WH7725> unto thy brother<WH251>.

And if thy brother<WH251> be not nigh<WH7138> unto thee<WH3045>, or if thou know him not<WH622>, then thou shalt bring it home to<WH8432> thy house<WH1004>, and it shall be with thee until thy brother<WH251> seek<WH1875> after it<WH7725>, and thou shalt restore it to him.

And so<WH3651> shalt thou do<WH6213> with his ass<WH2543>; and so shalt thou do<WH6213> with his garment<WH8071>; and so shalt thou do<WH6213> with every lost thing<WH9> of thy brother<WH251>'s, which he hath lost<WH6>, and thou hast found<WH4672>: thou mayest<WH3201> not hide thyself<WH5956>.

Thou shalt not see<WH7200> thy brother<WH251>'s ass<WH2543> or his ox<WH7794> fallen down<WH5307> by the way<WH1870>, and hide<WH5956> thyself from them<WH6965>: thou shalt surely help him to lift them up again<WH6965>.

A woman<WH802> shall not wear that which pertaineth<WH3627> unto a man<WH1397>, neither shall a man<WH1397> put<WH3847> on a woman<WH802>'s garment<WH8071>; for whosoever doeth<WH6213> these things<WH428> is an abomination<WH8441> unto Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.

If a bird<WH6833>'s nest<WH7064> chance<WH7122> to be before<WH6440> thee in the way<WH1870>, in any tree<WH6086> or on the ground<WH776>, with young ones<WH667> or eggs<WH1000>, and the dam<WH517> sitting<WH7257> upon the young<WH667>, or upon the eggs<WH1000>, thou shalt not take<WH3947> the dam<WH517> with the young<WH1121>:

thou shalt surely<WH7971> let the dam<WH517> go<WH7971>, but the young<WH1121> thou mayest take<WH3947> unto thyself<WH3190>; that it may be well with thee<WH748>, and that thou mayest prolong thy days<WH3117>.

When thou buildest<WH1129> a new<WH2319> house<WH1004>, then thou shalt make<WH6213> a battlement<WH4624> for thy roof<WH1406>, that thou bring<WH7760> not blood<WH1818> upon thy house<WH1004>, if any man<WH5307> fall from thence<WH5307>.

Thou shalt not sow<WH2232> thy vineyard<WH3754> with two kinds of seed<WH2233>, lest the whole fruit<WH4395> be forfeited<WH6942>, the seed<WH2233> which thou hast sown<WH2232>, and the increase<WH8393> of the vineyard<WH3754>.
Thou shalt not plow<WH2790> with an ox<WH7794> and an ass<WH2543> together<WH3162>.
Thou shalt not wear<WH3847> a mingled<WH8162> stuff<WH6785>, wool and linen<WH6593> together<WH3162>.
Thou shalt make<WH6213> thee fringes<WH1434> upon the four<WH702> borders<WH3671> of thy vesture<WH3682>, wherewith thou coverest thyself<WH3680>.
If any man<WH376> take<WH3947> a wife<WH802>, and go in<WH935> unto her<WH8130>, and hate her,

and lay<WH7760> shameful<WH5949> things<WH1697> to her charge<WH3318>, and bring up an evil<WH7451> name<WH8034> upon her<WH559>, and say, I took<WH3947> this woman<WH802>, and when I came<WH7126> nigh to her<WH4672>, I found not in her the tokens of virginity<WH1331>;

then shall the father<WH1> of the damsel<WH5291>, and her mother<WH517>, take<WH3947> and bring forth<WH3318> the tokens of the damsel<WH5291>'s virginity<WH1331> unto the elders<WH2205> of the city<WH5892> in the gate<WH8179>;
and the damsel<WH5291>'s father<WH1> shall say<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205>, I gave<WH5414> my daughter<WH1323> unto this man<WH376> to wife<WH802>, and he hateth her<WH8130>;

and <WH7760>, lo, he hath laid shameful<WH5949> things<WH1697> to her charge<WH559>, saying, I found<WH4672> not in thy daughter<WH1323> the tokens of virginity<WH1331>; and yet these are the tokens of my daughter<WH1323>'s virginity<WH1331>. And they shall spread<WH6566> the garment<WH8071> before<WH6440> the elders<WH2205> of the city<WH5892>.
And the elders<WH2205> of that city<WH5892> shall take<WH3947> the man<WH376> and chastise him<WH3256>;

and they shall fine<WH6064> him a hundred<WH3967> shekels of silver<WH3701>, and give<WH5414> them unto the father<WH1> of the damsel<WH5291>, because he hath brought up<WH3318> an evil<WH7451> name<WH8034> upon a virgin<WH1330> of Israel<WH3478>: and she shall be his wife<WH802>; he may<WH3201> not put her away<WH7971> all his days<WH3117>.
But if this thing<WH1697> be true<WH571>, that the tokens of virginity<WH1331> were not found<WH4672> in the damsel<WH5291>;

then they shall bring out<WH3318> the damsel<WH5291> to the door<WH6607> of her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>, and the men<WH582> of her city<WH5892> shall stone<WH5619> her to death<WH4191> with stones<WH68>, because she hath wrought<WH6213> folly<WH5039> in Israel<WH3478>, to play the harlot<WH2181> in her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>: so shalt thou put<WH1197> away<WH1197> the evil<WH7451> from the midst of thee<WH7130>.

If a man<WH376> be found<WH4672> lying<WH7901> with a woman<WH802> married<WH1166> to a husband<WH1167>, then they shall both of them<WH8147> die<WH4191>, the man<WH376> that lay<WH7901> with the woman<WH802>, and the woman<WH802>: so shalt thou put away<WH1197> the evil<WH7451> from Israel<WH3478>.
If there be a damsel<WH5291> that is a virgin<WH1330> betrothed<WH781> unto a husband<WH376>, and a man<WH376> find<WH4672> her in the city<WH5892>, and lie with her<WH7901>;

then ye shall bring<WH3318> them both<WH8147> out unto the gate<WH8179> of that city<WH5892>, and ye shall stone<WH5619> them to death<WH4191> with stones<WH68>; the damsel<WH5291>, because<WH834> she cried<WH6817> not<WH5892>, being in the city; and the man<WH376>, because<WH834> he hath humbled<WH6031> his neighbor<WH7453>'s wife<WH802>: so thou shalt put away<WH1197> the evil<WH7451> from the midst of thee<WH7130>.

But if the man<WH376> find<WH4672> the damsel<WH5291> that is betrothed<WH781> in the field<WH7704>, and the man<WH376> force<WH2388> her<WH7901>, and lie with her<WH376>; then the man only that lay<WH7901> with her shall die<WH4191>:

but unto the damsel<WH5291> thou shalt do<WH6213> nothing<WH1697>; there is in the damsel<WH5291> no sin<WH2399> worthy of death<WH4194>: for as when a man<WH376> riseth<WH6965> against his neighbor<WH7453>, and slayeth<WH7523> him<WH1697>, even so is this matter;
for he found<WH4672> her in the field<WH7704>, the betrothed<WH781> damsel<WH5291> cried<WH6817>, and there was none to save her<WH3467>.
If a man<WH376> find<WH4672> a damsel<WH5291> that is a virgin<WH1330>, that is not betrothed<WH781>, and lay hold<WH8610> on her<WH7901>, and lie with her<WH4672>, and they be found;

then the man<WH376> that lay<WH7901> with her shall give<WH5414> unto the damsel<WH5291>'s father<WH1> fifty<WH2572> shekels of silver<WH3701>, and she shall be his wife<WH802>, because he hath humbled<WH6031> her<WH3201>; he may not put her away<WH7971> all his days<WH3117>.
A man<WH376> shall not take<WH3947> his father<WH1>'s wife<WH802>, and shall not uncover<WH1540> his father<WH1>'s skirt<WH3671>.
